org.fluidity.composition.spi

Interface ComponentFactory.Resolver

  • Enclosing interface:
    ComponentFactory

    public static interface ComponentFactory.Resolver
    Container to resolve dependencies of some component to be created by the component factory.

    Usage

    See Also:
    ComponentFactory, ComponentFactory.Container

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> Dependency<T> constant(T object)
      Wraps the given object as a dependency.
      Constructor<?> constructor(Class<?> type)
      Returns the dependency injectable constructor of the given component class.
      Dependency<?>[] discover(Class<?> type)
      Calls constructor(Class) on the given type, calls resolve(Constructor) therewith, and returns the result.
      Dependency<?>[] discover(Class<?> type, Method method)
      Informs the recipient about the injectable constructor parameters of the given component class, and then returns a list of dependencies, each corresponding to the parameters of the supplied parameter injected method.
      Dependency<?>[] discover(Constructor<?> constructor)
      Informs the recipient about the injectable constructor parameters of the given component class, and then returns a list of dependencies, each corresponding to the parameters of the supplied constructor.
      Object[] instantiate(Dependency<?>... dependencies)
      Returns an array containing the instance of each dependency in the given array.
      <T> T invoke(Constructor<T> constructor, Dependency<?>... arguments)
      Invokes the given constructor with the given arguments.
      Object invoke(Object target, Method method, Dependency<?>... arguments)
      Invokes the given method with the given arguments.
      Dependency<?> lookup(Type reference)
      Dynamically looks up a component bound to a component interface that is assignable to the given reference, and then calls discover(Class) with it.
      Dependency<?> resolve(Class<?> type, Field field)
      Resolves the given field of the given type class.
      Dependency<?>[] resolve(Class<?> type, Method method)
      Invokes resolve(Class, Method, int) for every parameter of the given method with the given type class, and returns the result.

      Resolves the given parameter of the given method of the given type class.
      Dependency<?>[] resolve(Constructor<?> constructor)
      Resolves each resolvable parameter of the given constructor and returns a list of dependencies for each method parameter, resolvable or not.
      Dependency<?> resolve(Constructor<?> constructor, int parameter)
      Resolves the given parameter of the given constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • resolve

        Dependency<?> resolve(Constructor<?> constructor,
                      int parameter)
        Resolves the given parameter of the given constructor. Qualifier defined on the constructor's declaring class, the constructor itself, and the parameter, and consumed by the resolved component, will be added to its context. Component context is automatically passed on to the found component.
        Parameters:
        constructor - the constructor to resolve the given parameter of.
        parameter - index of the constructor parameter to derive generic type and context from.
        Returns:
        an object that can return an instance of the resolved dependency; may be null.

      • resolve

        Dependency<?> resolve(Class<?> type,
                      Method method,
                      int parameter)
        Resolves the given parameter of the given method of the given type class. Qualifier defined on the given class, the method, and the parameter, and consumed by the resolved component, will be added to its context. Component context is automatically passed on to the found component.
        Parameters:
        type - the class the method will be invoked on; may be null, in which case the method's declaring class will be used.
        method - the method to resolve the given parameter of.
        parameter - index of the constructor parameter to derive generic type and context from.
        Returns:
        an object that can return an instance of the resolved dependency; may be null.

      • resolve

        Dependency<?> resolve(Class<?> type,
                      Field field)
        Resolves the given field of the given type class. Qualifier defined on the given class and the field, and consumed by the resolved component, will be added to its context. Component context is automatically passed on to the found component.
        Parameters:
        type - the class the field will used with; may be null, in which case the field's declaring class will be used.
        field - field to derive generic type and context from.
        Returns:
        an object that can return an instance of the resolved dependency; may be null.

      • resolve

        Dependency<?>[] resolve(Class<?> type,
                        Method method)
        Invokes resolve(Class, Method, int) for every parameter of the given method with the given type class, and returns the result. Component context is automatically passed on to the found component.
        Parameters:
        type - the class the method will be invoked on; may be null, in which case the method's declaring class will be used.
        method - the method to resolve the parameters of.
        Returns:
        a list of dependencies that can then be used to get a dependency Dependency.instance() of; never null, but the elements may be null.

      • resolve

        Dependency<?>[] resolve(Constructor<?> constructor)
        Resolves each resolvable parameter of the given constructor and returns a list of dependencies for each method parameter, resolvable or not. The returned array is mutable and can be fed to instantiate(Dependency[]) to get an argument list to invoke the constructor with. Component context is automatically passed on to the found component.
        Parameters:
        constructor - the constructor to resolve the parameters of.
        Returns:
        a list of dependencies that can then be used to get instances of.

      • discover

        Dependency<?>[] discover(Class<?> type)
        Calls constructor(Class) on the given type, calls resolve(Constructor) therewith, and returns the result. Component context is automatically passed on to the found component.
        Parameters:
        type - the component class.
        Returns:
        a list of dependencies that can then be used to get instances of.

      • lookup

        Dependency<?> lookup(Type reference)
        Dynamically looks up a component bound to a component interface that is assignable to the given reference, and then calls discover(Class) with it.
        Parameters:
        reference - the generic reference to the component to look up.
        Returns:
        an object that can return an instance of the resolved dependency; may be null.

      • constructor

        Constructor<?> constructor(Class<?> type)
        Returns the dependency injectable constructor of the given component class. The returned value can be used to instantiate the component using the dependencies discovered by the discover(Class) method.
        Parameters:
        type - the component class.
        Returns:
        the dependency injectable constructor of the given component class.

      • discover

        Dependency<?>[] discover(Constructor<?> constructor)
        Informs the recipient about the injectable constructor parameters of the given component class, and then returns a list of dependencies, each corresponding to the parameters of the supplied constructor. If no dependency is found, and the class that defines the constructor is annotated with @Component, and @Optional is not among annotations, this method throws a ComponentContainer.ResolutionException.

        Use this method if the component has multiple constructors and the invoking dependency injection container would not be able to figure out which one to use. Otherwise use the discover(Class).

        Parameters:
        constructor - the constructor.
        Returns:
        a list of dependencies corresponding to the constructor parameters.

      • discover

        Dependency<?>[] discover(Class<?> type,
                         Method method)
        Informs the recipient about the injectable constructor parameters of the given component class, and then returns a list of dependencies, each corresponding to the parameters of the supplied parameter injected method. If no dependency is found, and the given type class is annotated with @Component, and @Optional is not among annotations, this method throws a ComponentContainer.ResolutionException.
        Parameters:
        type - the class that the given method will be invoked on; may not be null.
        method - the method.
        Returns:
        a list of dependencies corresponding to the parameters of the supplied factory method.

      • constant

        <T> Dependency<T> constant(T object)
        Wraps the given object as a dependency. Useful to fill in missing constructor or method arguments in the Dependency array returned by those methods before feeding the array to instantiate(Dependency[]).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the dependency type the given object satisfies.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to wrap as a dependency.
        Returns:
        the dependency whose Dependency.instance() method will return the given object.

      • instantiate

        Object[] instantiate(Dependency<?>... dependencies)
        Returns an array containing the instance of each dependency in the given array.
        Parameters:
        dependencies - the dependency array; may not be null.
        Returns:
        an array of objects; never null.

      • invoke

        <T> T invoke(Constructor<T> constructor,
             Dependency<?>... arguments)
      throws Exception
        Invokes the given constructor with the given arguments. This method is provided as a convenience and intended to be used in ComponentFactory.Bindings.bind(ComponentFactory.Registry).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class in which the constructor is declared.
        Parameters:
        constructor - the constructor to call Constructor.newInstance(Object...) on; never null.
        arguments - the arguments to pass to Constructor.newInstance(Object...) to.
        Returns:
        the constructed object.
        Throws:
        Exception - whatever constructor throws with the given arguments.

      • invoke

        Object invoke(Object target,
              Method method,
              Dependency<?>... arguments)
       throws Exception
        Invokes the given method with the given arguments. This method is provided as a convenience and intended to be used in ComponentFactory.Bindings.bind(ComponentFactory.Registry).
        Parameters:
        target - the object to call the method on; may be null for static methods.
        method - the method to invoke; never null.
        arguments - the arguments to invoke the method with.
        Returns:
        whatever method returns with the given arguments.
        Throws:
        Exception - whatever method throws with the given arguments.
